Area.description:
The property Area is of type integer and an example is "36".
It indicates the the extent of a 2-dimensional surface enclosed within a boundary.

Median_Wage.description:
The property Median_Wage is of type integer and an example is "46010".
It indicates the Wage of Median (the value below which 50% of the cases fall).

Mean_Wage.description:
The property Mean_Wage is of type integer and an example is "63270".
It indicates the Wage of Mean (the sum of the values of a random variable divided by the number of values).

Employment.description:
The property Employment is of type integer and an example is "9385620".
It indicates the employment is the debut studio album by English indie rock band Kaiser Chiefs, released in March 2005 on B-Unique Records..

Entry_Wage.description:
The property Entry_Wage is of type integer and an example is "26210".
It indicates the Wage of Entry (a written record of a commercial transaction).

Standard_Occupational_Code.description:
The property Standard_Occupational_Code is of type string and an example is " 00-0000".
It indicates the Standard (a board measure = 1980 board feet) Occupational Code (a set of rules or principles or laws (especially written ones)).

Area_Type.description:
The property Area_Type is of type integer and an example is "1".
It indicates the Type of Area (the extent of a 2-dimensional surface enclosed within a boundary).

Area_Name.description:
The property Area_Name is of type string and an example is "New York State".
It indicates the Name of Area (a particular geographical region of indefinite boundary (usually serving some special purpose or distinguished by its people or culture or geography)).

Experienced_Wage.description:
The property Experienced_Wage is of type integer and an example is "81790".
It indicates the Wage of Experienced (the accumulation of knowledge or skill that results from direct participation in events or activities).

Occupational_Title.description:
The property Occupational_Title is of type string and an example is "Total. All Occupations".
It indicates the Title of Occupational.

get.description:
Find EmploymentData by visualisation.
This API method can be used to find EmploymentData data by visualisation, and you must filter the results by a specific visualisation.
These results will contain the following fields: Area, Median_Wage, Mean_Wage, Employment, Entry_Wage, Standard_Occupational_Code, Area_Type, Area_Name, Experienced_Wage, Occupational_Title.
An example of using this method is "https://wake.dlsi.ua.es/EmploymentAPI/visualisation/" or "https://wake.dlsi.ua.es/EmploymentAPI/?visualisation=", whose result would include at least the following record:
{ "Area" : 36, "Median_Wage" : 46010, "Mean_Wage" : 63270, "Employment" : 9385620, "Entry_Wage" : 26210, "Standard_Occupational_Code" : 00-0000, "Area_Type" : 1, "Area_Name" : New York State, "Experienced_Wage" : 81790, "Occupational_Title" : Total. All Occupations }

Find EmploymentData by Median_Wage.
This API method can be used to find EmploymentData data by Median_Wage, and you must filter the results by a specific Median_Wage.
These results will contain the following fields: Area, Median_Wage, Mean_Wage, Employment, Entry_Wage, Standard_Occupational_Code, Area_Type, Area_Name, Experienced_Wage, Occupational_Title.
An example of using this method is "https://wake.dlsi.ua.es/EmploymentAPI/Median_Wage/46010" or "https://wake.dlsi.ua.es/EmploymentAPI/?Median_Wage=46010", whose result would include at least the following record:
{ "Area" : 36, "Median_Wage" : 46010, "Mean_Wage" : 63270, "Employment" : 9385620, "Entry_Wage" : 26210, "Standard_Occupational_Code" : 00-0000, "Area_Type" : 1, "Area_Name" : New York State, "Experienced_Wage" : 81790, "Occupational_Title" : Total. All Occupations }

parameters.name: Median_Wage
parameters.description:
The parameter Median_Wage is of type integer and an example is "46010".
This parameter is required and  must be in path.
It indicates the Wage of Median (the value below which 50% of the cases fall).

get.description:
Find all EmploymentData.
This API method can be used to find all EmploymentData, and you can filter the results by different parameters at the same time: Area, Median_Wage, Mean_Wage, Employment, Entry_Wage, Standard_Occupational_Code, Area_Type, Area_Name, Experienced_Wage, Occupational_Title.
These results will contain the following fields: Area, Median_Wage, Mean_Wage, Employment, Entry_Wage, Standard_Occupational_Code, Area_Type, Area_Name, Experienced_Wage, Occupational_Title.
An example of using this method is "https://wake.dlsi.ua.es/EmploymentAPI/", whose result would include all the records until the limit.
Furthermore, the results can be filtered as mentioned before using the following pattern "/?field1=value1&field2=value2&...".
An example of this type of filtering is: "https://wake.dlsi.ua.es/EmploymentAPI/?Area=36&Median_Wage=46010"
It is possible to specify the "limit" and the "offset" parameters in order to paginate the results.

get.description:
Find EmploymentData by Area.
This API method can be used to find EmploymentData data by Area, and you must filter the results by a specific Area.
These results will contain the following fields: Area, Median_Wage, Mean_Wage, Employment, Entry_Wage, Standard_Occupational_Code, Area_Type, Area_Name, Experienced_Wage, Occupational_Title.
An example of using this method is "https://wake.dlsi.ua.es/EmploymentAPI/Area/36" or "https://wake.dlsi.ua.es/EmploymentAPI/?Area=36", whose result would include at least the following record:
{ "Area" : 36, "Median_Wage" : 46010, "Mean_Wage" : 63270, "Employment" : 9385620, "Entry_Wage" : 26210, "Standard_Occupational_Code" : 00-0000, "Area_Type" : 1, "Area_Name" : New York State, "Experienced_Wage" : 81790, "Occupational_Title" : Total. All Occupations }

parameters.name: Area

info.description:
This interactive documentation allows to extract information from data about “EmploymentData“ in a simple way without having to be an expert in APIs. This API allows to filter by different characteristics, for example: Area, Median_Wage, Mean_Wage, Employment, Entry_Wage, Standard_Occupational_Code, Area_Type, Area_Name, Experienced_Wage, Occupational_Title.
The API response will be in JSON format, containing a list of objects with properties: Area, Median_Wage, Mean_Wage, Employment, Entry_Wage, Standard_Occupational_Code, Area_Type, Area_Name, Experienced_Wage, Occupational_Title.
In addition, the following parameters can always be used: limit, which serves to limit the maximum number of results to show (default 10000); and offset, to indicate from which number to return from the results set, very useful for pagination results.
An example of a query would be the following: https://wake.dlsi.ua.es/EmploymentAPI/Area/36
You can also query the API by different parameters at the same time using the API main method as follows: https://wake.dlsi.ua.es/EmploymentAPI/?Area=36&Median_Wage=46010
info.title: EmploymentData
